description: Returns the description of a specific Amazon EFS access point if the AccessPointId is provided. If you provide an EFS FileSystemId, it returns descriptions of all access points for that file system. You can provide either an AccessPointId or a FileSystemId in the request, but not both. This operation requires permissions for the elasticfilesystem:DescribeAccessPoints action.

nested_items.name: AccessPoints
nested_items.description: An array of access point descriptions.

nested_items.name: ClientToken
nested_items.description: The opaque string specified in the request to ensure idempotent creation.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the access point. This is the value of the Name tag.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags associated with the access point, presented as an array of Tag objects.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The tag key (String). The key can't start with aws:.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag key.

nested_items.name: AccessPointId
nested_items.description: The ID of the access point, assigned by Amazon EFS.

nested_items.name: AccessPointArn
nested_items.description: The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the access point.

nested_items.name: FileSystemId
nested_items.description: The ID of the EFS file system that the access point applies to.

nested_items.name: PosixUser
nested_items.description: The full POSIX identity, including the user ID, group ID, and secondary group IDs on the access point that is used for all file operations by NFS clients using the access point.

nested_items.name: Uid
nested_items.description: The POSIX user ID used for all file system operations using this access point.

nested_items.name: Gid
nested_items.description: The POSIX group ID used for all file system operations using this access point.

nested_items.name: SecondaryGids
nested_items.description: Secondary POSIX group IDs used for all file system operations using this access point.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: RootDirectory
nested_items.description: The directory on the EFS file system that the access point exposes as the root directory to NFS clients using the access point.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: Specifies the path on the EFS file system to expose as the root directory to NFS clients using the access point to access the EFS file system. A path can have up to four subdirectories. If the specified path does not exist, you are required to provide the CreationInfo.

nested_items.name: CreationInfo
nested_items.description: (Optional) Specifies the POSIX IDs and permissions to apply to the access point's RootDirectory. If the RootDirectory > Path specified does not exist, EFS creates the root directory using the CreationInfo settings when a client connects to an access point. When specifying the CreationInfo, you must provide values for all properties.

nested_items.name: OwnerUid
nested_items.description: Specifies the POSIX user ID to apply to the RootDirectory. Accepts values from 0 to 2^32 (4294967295).

nested_items.name: OwnerGid
nested_items.description: Specifies the POSIX group ID to apply to the RootDirectory. Accepts values from 0 to 2^32 (4294967295).

nested_items.name: Permissions
nested_items.description: Specifies the POSIX permissions to apply to the RootDirectory, in the format of an octal number representing the file's mode bits.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: Identifies the Amazon Web Services account that owns the access point resource.

nested_items.name: LifeCycleState
nested_items.description: Identifies the lifecycle phase of the access point.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: Present if there are more access points than returned in the response. You can use the NextMarker in the subsequent request to fetch the additional descriptions.
